KPK Panggil Lukma Neska, Saksi Tersangka Bambang Irianto Terkait Dugaan Suap Minyak
07 Nov 2019, 14:22 by Eko Sulestyono


KPK Panggil Lukma Neska, Saksi Tersangka Bambang Irianto Terkait Dugaan Suap Minyak

KBRN, Jakarta : Penyidik Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi (KPK) dijadwalkan memanggil saksi dalam kasus perkara dugaan Tindak Pidana Korupsi (Tipikor) suap perdagangan minyak mentah dan produk kilang di PT. Pertamina Energy Services (PES) Pte Ltd.
Kabiro Humas KPK Febri Diansyah kepada wartawan di Jakarta menjelaskan bahwa saksi yang dipanggil  penyidik KPK bernama Lukma Neska, Direktur Utama (Dirut) PT Anugrah Pabuaran Regency Lukma Neska.
Febri mengatakan bahwa yang bersangkutan (Lukma Neska)  dijadwalkan akan diperiksa untuk tersangka Bambang Irianto (BTO) Managing Director Pertamina Energy Services Pte. Ltd (PES) periode masa jabatan  2009 hingga 2013.
“Dijadwalkan pemeriksaan terhadap Direktur Utama PT Anugrah Pabuaran Regency Lukma Neska, yang bersangkutan diperiksa dalam kapasitasnya sebagai saksi untuk tersangka BTO (Bambang Irianto)” kata Febri Diansyah di Jakarta, Kamis (7/11/2019).
Menurut Febri, pemeriksaan Lukma Neska terkait kasus dugaan tindak pidana korupsi suap perdagangan minyak mentah dan produk kilang di Pertamina Energy Services.
Penyidik KPK sebelumnya telah menetapkan Bambang sebagai tersangka, yang bersangkutan  diketahui juga pernah menjabat sebagai Direktur Utama (Dirut) Pertamina Energy Trading Ltd (Petral) sebelum perusahaan tersebut seara resmi telah dibiarkan pada 2015.
Penyidik KPK sebelumnya juga pernah memanggil Bambang dalam kapasitasnya sebagai tersangka. Penyidik KPK saat itu sempat mendalami keterangan tersangka Bambang terjait adanya aliran dana dalam kasus perkara dugaan suap.
Meskipun Bambang Irianto telah menyandang status sebagai tersangka dalam kasus dugaan suap, namun hingga saat ini Bambang belum ditahan penyidik KPK. Bambang saat itu juga sempat ditanya seputar  tugas, pokok, dan fungsi (tupoksi)  saat dirinya masih menjabat sebagai Vice President (VP) dan Managing Director PES.
KPK meyakini bahwa tersangka Bambang diduga mengarahkan untuk tetap mengundang NOC tersebut meskipun mengetahui bahwa NOC itu bukan pihak yang mengirim kargo ke PES/PT Pertamina.
Bambang disangkakan telah melanggar Pasal 12 huruf a atau Pasal 12 huruf b subsider Pasal 11 Undang-Undang Nomor 31 Tahun 1999 sebagaimana telah diubah dengan Undang-Undang Nomor 20 Tahun 2001 tentang Pemberantasan Tindak Pidana Korupsi (Tipikor).

KPK Summons Lukma Neska, Witness of the Suspect Bambang Irianto Regarding Alleged Oil Bribery
Nov 7 2019, 14:22 by Eko Sulestyono


KPK Summons Lukma Neska, Witness of the Suspect Bambang Irianto Regarding Alleged Oil Bribery

KBRN, Jakarta: Investigators of the Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) are scheduled to summon witnesses in cases of alleged Corruption (Tipikor) bribery in the trade of crude oil and refinery products at PT. Pertamina Energy Services (PES) Pte Ltd.
KPK Head of Public Relations, Febri Diansyah, told reporters in Jakarta that the witness who was summoned by KPK investigators was named Lukma Neska, Managing Director (Managing Director) of PT Anugrah Pabuaran Regency Lukma Neska.
Febri said that the person concerned (Lukma Neska) was scheduled to be examined for the suspect Bambang Irianto (BTO) Managing Director of Pertamina Energy Services Pte. Ltd (PES) tenure period 2009 to 2013.
"Scheduled an examination of the Managing Director of PT Anugrah Pabuaran Regency Lukma Neska, concerned concerned in his capacity as a witness for the suspect BTO (Bambang Irianto)" said Febri Diansyah in Jakarta, Thursday (11/07/2019).
According to Febri, Lukma Neska's investigation was related to a case of alleged corruption in the bribery of trading crude oil and refinery products at Pertamina Energy Services.
KPK investigators had previously named Bambang a suspect, he was also known to have served as Managing Director (Director) of Pertamina Energy Trading Ltd (Petral) before the company was officially released in 2015.
KPK investigators had also previously called Bambang in his capacity as a suspect. The KPK investigator at that time briefly explored the information of the suspect Bambang related to the flow of funds in the case of alleged bribery.
Although Bambang Irianto has assumed the status of a suspect in a bribery case, Bambang has not yet been detained by KPK investigators. Bambang at that time was also asked about his duties, main points, and functions (tupoksi) when he was still serving as Vice President (VP) and Managing Director of PES.
KPK believes that the suspect Bambang allegedly directed to continue to invite the NOC despite knowing that the NOC was not the party that sent the cargo to PES / PT Pertamina.
Bambang is alleged to have violated Article 12 letter a or Article 12 letter b subsider Article 11 of Law Number 31 of 1999 as amended by Law Number 20 of 2001 concerning Eradication of Corruption (Corruption).
